trans-unit.source: CDN - Improve performance by compressing files
trans-unit.target: CDN - Improve performance by compressing files

trans-unit.source: You can improve file transfer speed and increases page load performance by compressing your files.
trans-unit.target: You can improve file transfer speed and increases page load performance by compressing your files.

trans-unit.source: Improve performance by compressing files
trans-unit.target: Improve performance by compressing files

trans-unit.source: This topic discusses how to improve file transfer speed and increases page load performance by compressing your files.
trans-unit.target: This topic discusses how to improve file transfer speed and increases page load performance by compressing your files.

trans-unit.source: There are two ways CDN can support compression:
trans-unit.target: There are two ways CDN can support compression:

trans-unit.source: You can enable compression on your origin server, in which case the CDN will support compression by default and deliver compressed files to clients.
trans-unit.target: You can enable compression on your origin server, in which case the CDN will support compression by default and deliver compressed files to clients.

trans-unit.source: You can enable compression directly on CDN edge servers, in which case the CDN will compress the files and serve it to end users.
trans-unit.target: You can enable compression directly on CDN edge servers, in which case the CDN will compress the files and serve it to end users.

trans-unit.source: Definitions
trans-unit.target: Definitions

trans-unit.source: **Accept-Encoding** request header - This header indicates the compression methods a user agent supports.
trans-unit.target: **Accept-Encoding** request header - This header indicates the compression methods a user agent supports.

trans-unit.source: It must be included in the request header.
trans-unit.target: It must be included in the request header.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Header Field Definitions](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Header Field Definitions](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html).

trans-unit.source: **Content type** - A list of content types needs to be added for compression.
trans-unit.target: **Content type** - A list of content types needs to be added for compression.

trans-unit.source: Only text files are eligible for compression.
trans-unit.target: Only text files are eligible for compression.

trans-unit.source: E.g.
trans-unit.target: E.g.

trans-unit.source: text/plain, text/html.
trans-unit.target: text/plain, text/html.

trans-unit.source: **Compression method** - Supported compression methods are gzip/deflate/bzip2, a supported method must be set in the Accept-Encoding Request Header.
trans-unit.target: **Compression method** - Supported compression methods are gzip/deflate/bzip2, a supported method must be set in the Accept-Encoding Request Header.

trans-unit.source: **Cache status** - Cache status identifies whether the requested content is already cached on the POP closest to the requester.
trans-unit.target: **Cache status** - Cache status identifies whether the requested content is already cached on the POP closest to the requester.

trans-unit.source: **File size** - By default compression only supports files larger than 1 byte and smaller than 1MB.
trans-unit.target: **File size** - By default compression only supports files larger than 1 byte and smaller than 1MB.

trans-unit.source: Workflow
trans-unit.target: Workflow

trans-unit.source: Requester sends a request for content.
trans-unit.target: Requester sends a request for content.

trans-unit.source: An edge server checks whether there is **Accept-Encoding** header.
trans-unit.target: An edge server checks whether there is **Accept-Encoding** header.

trans-unit.source: If included, this header identifies the requested compression method.
trans-unit.target: If included, this header identifies the requested compression method.

trans-unit.source: If missing, this type of request will be served in an uncompressed format.
trans-unit.target: If missing, this type of request will be served in an uncompressed format.

trans-unit.source: The closest edge POP checks the cache status, compression method and if it still has a valid TTL.
trans-unit.target: The closest edge POP checks the cache status, compression method and if it still has a valid TTL.

trans-unit.source: Cache Miss: if the requested version is not cached, the request is forwarded to the origin.
trans-unit.target: Cache Miss: if the requested version is not cached, the request is forwarded to the origin.

trans-unit.source: Cache HIT with same compression method: The edge server will immediately deliver the compressed content to the client.
trans-unit.target: Cache HIT with same compression method: The edge server will immediately deliver the compressed content to the client.

trans-unit.source: Cache HIT with different compression method: The edge server will transcode the asset to the requested compression method.
trans-unit.target: Cache HIT with different compression method: The edge server will transcode the asset to the requested compression method.

trans-unit.source: Cache HIT and uncompressed : if the initial request caused the asset to be cached in an uncompressed format, then a check will be performed to see whether the request is eligible for edge server compression (based on the criteria in the definition/requirement section above.)
trans-unit.target: Cache HIT and uncompressed : if the initial request caused the asset to be cached in an uncompressed format, then a check will be performed to see whether the request is eligible for edge server compression (based on the criteria in the definition/requirement section above.)

trans-unit.source: If eligible, the edge server will compress the file and serve it to the client.
trans-unit.target: If eligible, the edge server will compress the file and serve it to the client.

trans-unit.source: If not eligible: the edge server will immediately deliver the uncompressed content to the client.
trans-unit.target: If not eligible: the edge server will immediately deliver the uncompressed content to the client.

trans-unit.source: File compression
trans-unit.target: File compression

trans-unit.source: Considerations
trans-unit.target: Considerations

trans-unit.source: For Media Services CDN enabled streaming endpoints, compression is enabled by default for the following content types: application/vnd.ms-sstr+xml,application/dash+xml,application/vnd.apple.mpegurl,application/f4m+xml.
trans-unit.target: For Media Services CDN enabled streaming endpoints, compression is enabled by default for the following content types: application/vnd.ms-sstr+xml,application/dash+xml,application/vnd.apple.mpegurl,application/f4m+xml.

trans-unit.source: You cannot enable/disable compression for the mentioned types using the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: You cannot enable/disable compression for the mentioned types using the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Only one file version (compressed or uncompressed) will be cached on the edge server.
trans-unit.target: Only one file version (compressed or uncompressed) will be cached on the edge server.

trans-unit.source: A request for a different version will result in the content being transcoded by the edge server.
trans-unit.target: A request for a different version will result in the content being transcoded by the edge server.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
